poemContent: Yesterday, or another day, I waked out into a crowd I looked around, and my ears were blasted out by the deathening of the thump, cries, screams, a ritual, 'TRUMP' And it wasn't ironic or some joke, I swear I saw the pope, And on large gallows, I saw a statue erect, a poor portrait, a precedent of the US so I walked up to the gallows, put my head in the hanging rope, told a man to pull the lever, in the nuts, I kicked the pope And as I started falling, there was one last thing I tried to say, "I DECLARE THAT YOU ARE ALL IDIOTS", I still believe this 'til my dying day. 
